result.execSummary:
The defendant Chevelle S. Milham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Ordinance Violation - Bail Jumping. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chevelle S. Milham

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Chevelle S. Milham in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:56 PM. Called 16CM163, 16CT63 and 17CM60. State - 16CT23 - plead to only count, fine of $500.00 plus costs and surcharges; 16CM163 - #2 - amend to county ordinance of BJ with fine of $500.00 plus costs, count #1 - plead as alleged - 10 days jail - credit for time served, $300.00 fine plus costs, #3 - DRI; 17CM60 - plead g/nc to count #1 as alleged - $300.00 fine plus costs, #2 - amend to ordinance BJ - $500 with costs, #3 and #4 - DRI. Joy and Milham agree. Court makes sure the defendant understands what it means for a count to be DRI. Court - 17CM60 - dismisses and reads in counts #3 and #4; 16CM163 - dismisses and reads in count #3. Court - 16CM163 - amend count #2 to county ordinance of BJ - pleads NC - finds G - fine of $500.00 plus costs - take bond posted; 17CM60 - court amends count #2 to county ordinance of BJ - plead NC, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs - take bond posted. Milham pleads NC to count #1 as alleged on 16CT23, pleads NC to count #1 on 16CM163, pleads NC to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, volutarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Milham withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CT23 - count #1 - fine of $300.00 plus costs and surcharges - take bond posted (Court changed the amount of the fine for stated reasons); 16CM163 - count #1 - 10 days in FC jail - credit for 10 days for time served, $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - take bond posted; 17CM60 - count #1 - $300.00 fine plus costs and surchares - take bond posted, transfer bonds posted to be able to pay all fines, refund remainder if any or 60 DTP if not enough/CO, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on June 28, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on May 3, 2017 at 03:15 pm.

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:15 PM. Called 16CM163 and 16CT23. Joy has filed Auth to Appear on both cases, waives reading of both cases, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts NG pleas on both cases, continues bond on both cases, set both matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 3, 2017 at 03:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 1, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Chevelle S. Milham appears via video from FC jail, attorney Chad Lynch who appears specially under direction of Attorney Joy. No one appears for the State of Wisconsin due to a medical emergency. Carissa Matuszewski appears for the State. Called at 9:37 AM. Called 16CM163 and 16CT23. Milham has both complaints. Court reads charges and penalties for both cases. Milham and Lynch understand charges and penalties. Lynch waives further reading on both complaints, wants to be heard on bond and requests that both matters be set for AIA. Lynch - bond - $2000.00 cash bond total for stated reasons . Court - bond on 16CT23 - $750.00 cash with no consumption of alcohol. Court - bond on 16CM163 - $1000.00 cash with no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Return on warrant on February 22, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Chevelle S. Milham not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:36 AM. State - mailed S&C to last known address and not returned, requests forfeiture of any bond posted, body or $1000.00. Court orders.
